intro: Selago oresigena, commonly known as the rock selago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Selago oresigena is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
